metadata.description: contains information about the current API version, how and when the current response was produced, and keys of liturgical events that can have precedence over others, useful for further calculations of a local calendar

timestamp.description: Certainly cannot be any earlier than the start of the project itself July 26, 2017; we'll set the max to Dec 12th, 9999

Accept.description: If present, must contain at least one of the following

X-Requested-With.description: Will only appear for AJAX requests, and will only ever have a value of XMLHttpRequest

litcal.description: the liturgical events that make up the requested Liturgical Calendar for the given year

messages.description: an array containing all of the significant operations done in the calculation of the requested Liturgical Calendar, with links to the Decrees of the Dicastery for Divine Worship and the Discipline of the Sacraments where applicable. Useful for understanding how or why the calculations were done, and what changes have been applied in the generation of the Calendar for the specific year requested.

litcal.name: Sancti Basilii Magni et Gregorii Nazianzeni, episcoporum et Ecclesiæ doctorum

messages: The Solemnity 'Sancti Ioseph Sponsi Beatæ Mariæ Virginis' falls on Dominica IV in Quadragesima in the year 2023, the celebration has been transferred to the following Monday (20 Martius) as per the Decree of the Dicastery for Divine Worship and the Discipline of the Sacraments.
'Dominica XVIII «Per Annum»' is superseded by the FESTUM DOMINI 'In Transfiguratione Domini' in the year 2023.

DateTimeObjectCollection.title: Date Time Object Collection
DateTimeObjectCollection.description: a collection of date-time objects representing liturgical events, such as the solemnities of the Lord and the Blessed Virgin Mary, solemnities, feasts of the Lord, feasts, memorials, suppressed events, or reinstated events

LiturgicalEventVigil.title: Liturgical Event Vigil (Evening Mass)
LiturgicalEventVigil.description: When we say vigil, it is in the broad sense of the term, as in the evening Mass on the day preceding the main celebration, where the readings are often the same as those of the day of the main celebration.

event_idx.title: Event Index
event_idx.description: A sequential index number assigned to each liturgical event in the calendar, starting from 0 for the first event that is calculated. This index helps to uniquely identify and reference each event within the liturgical calendar for that year, seeing that the `event_key` property might not be unique.

name.title: Liturgical Event Name
name.description: the full name of the liturgical event in the locale requested and according to the current requested calendar (i.e. General Roman Calendar, National Calendar, Diocesan Calendar)

date.title: Liturgical Event Date
date.description: the date of the liturgical event in ISO 8601 (RFC 3339) format, always at midnight UTC time

color_lcl.title: Liturgical Color Localized
color_lcl.description: an array of localized strings describing the liturgical color(s) associated with the celebration; if more than one liturgical common is associated with a celebration, there may be more than one color associated with the celebration

grade_lcl.title: Liturgical Grade Localized
grade_lcl.description: a localized string describing the liturgical grade of the celebration, such as 'Solemnity', 'Feast', 'Memorial', etc., according to the locale requested

grade_abbr.title: Liturgical Grade Abbreviation
grade_abbr.description: a localized abbreviation for the liturgical grade of the celebration, such as 'S' for Solemnity, 'F' for Feast, 'M' for Memorial, etc.

grade_display.title: Liturgical Grade Display
grade_display.description: a localized string for display purposes that may differ from the standard name of the liturgical grade; can be null if no special display name is needed, or an empty string if no particular grade is meant to be shown. For example, for Higher Grade Solemnities it would be undesirable to display 'Solemnity with precedence over other solemnities', so this property would be an empty string in that case; or for All Souls Day which is logically treated as a Solemnity but displayed as a 'Commemoration' or as an 'Optional memorial' (according to local translations), so a localized string such as 'Commemoration' or 'Optional memorial' would be appropriate.

common_lcl.title: Liturgical Common Localized
common_lcl.description: a localized string describing the liturgical Proper or common(s) (if any) associated with the celebration, according to the locale requested

day_of_the_week_iso8601.title: Day of the Week ISO 8601
day_of_the_week_iso8601.description: the day of the week for the liturgical event, following the ISO 8601 standard where Monday is 1 and Sunday is 7

month.title: Month
month.description: the month for the liturgical event, represented as an integer from 1 (January) to 12 (December)

day.title: Day
day.description: the day of the month for the liturgical event, represented as an integer from 1 to 31 depending on the month

year.title: Year
year.description: the year for the liturgical event, between 1969 and 9999; will have the same value for all events when requesting a CIVIL year calendar, but may differ when requesting a LITURGICAL year calendar (i.e. events from the first Sunday of Advent to December 31 will have the previous year as their year value, and events from January 1 to the last Saturday following Christ the King will have the requested year as their year value)

month_short.title: Month Short Name
month_short.description: a localized abbreviated string for the month of the liturgical event, such as 'gen.' for January if Italian was requested

month_long.title: Month Long Name
month_long.description: a localized full string for the month of the liturgical event, such as 'gennaio' for January if Italian was requested

day_of_the_week_short.title: Day of the Week Short Name
day_of_the_week_short.description: a localized abbreviated string for the day of the week of the liturgical event, such as 'lun.' for Monday if Italian was requested

day_of_the_week_long.title: Day of the Week Long Name
day_of_the_week_long.description: a localized full string for the day of the week of the liturgical event, such as 'lunedi' for Monday if Italian was requested

liturgical_year.title: Liturgical Year
liturgical_year.description: a localized string representing the liturgical year designation (YEAR A, YEAR B, or YEAR C for Sundays and Solemnities; YEAR I or YEAR II for weekdays) according to the liturgical calendar cycle in use for the requested year

is_vigil_mass.title: Is Vigil Mass
is_vigil_mass.description: the property will only exist and will be true if the celebration is a Vigil Mass (i.e., the evening Mass on the day before a solemnity or sunday where the readings may be the same as those used on the day itself); otherwise the property will be absent

is_vigil_for.title: Is Vigil For
is_vigil_for.description: the `event_key` of the main celebration for which this vigil mass is being held

liturgical_season.title: Liturgical Season
liturgical_season.description: an enumeration value of the liturgical season in which the event falls, one of: ADVENT, CHRISTMAS, LENT, EASTER_TRIDUUM, EASTER, ORDINARY_TIME

liturgical_season_lcl.title: Liturgical Season Localized
liturgical_season_lcl.description: a localized string representing the name of the liturgical season in which the event falls, according to the locale requested

psalter_week.title: Psalter Week
psalter_week.description: the psalter week (1 to 4) for the liturgical event, used in the Liturgy of the Hours, if applicable; otherwise 0

holy_day_of_obligation.title: Is Holy Day of Obligation
holy_day_of_obligation.description: the property will only exist and will be true if the celebration is a Holy Day of Obligation, according to the calendar requested; otherwise the property will be absent

LiturgicalEvent.title: Liturgical Event
LiturgicalEvent.description: a liturgical event in the calendar, such as a solemnity, feast, memorial, temporal celebration, weekday etc.
